content.rendered:
“It is a safe investment, there is no loss”, “you will earn quickly”, “bring friends and you will also earn for them”. Have you ever heard those phrases from people, friends or relatives who offer you a great deal. On the Internet there are also offers with juicy investment profits. Be very careful, it could be a financial pyramid or one internet scam.

MORE INFORMATION: Trading: Increase scams to people who decide to invest in cryptocurrencies

What is a pyramid scam? A pyramid scheme is a type of fraud in which the participants themselves must grow it through the creation of a network in which they attract new participants with the aim that the new produce benefits for the original participants, but there comes a time when it becomes unsustainable.

“This is a hidden scam about a supposed business, which does not do any real business. It uses the participants and at some point it explodes, harming those below. Clae was a financial pyramid, just like the Loom of Dreams.”explains to El Comercio Jorge Carrillo-Acosta, the finance specialist at the Pacific Business School.

The expert warns that offers of easy, safe and honest money should be distrusted because it is difficult. For this reason, he gave some recommendations so that you do not let yourself be dazzled.

MORE INFORMATION: SBS warns of possible scams in new pyramid business schemes

HOW TO DETECT A PYRAMID OR INTERNET INVESTMENT SCAM?

Here are some tips for identifying a pyramid or Internet scam.

  • Verify that the company exists: look for the RUC and legal representative. Know the address.
  • Check if the activity of raising money from the public has prior authorization from the Superintendency of Banking, Insurance and AFPs (SBS).
  • Investigate and ask acquaintances to find out that the company exists.
  • Check the Internet pages that offer you to invest in cryptocurrencies and in the stock market with guaranteed profit. They may be fake agents.

MORE INFORMATION: How to Spot a Cyber ​​Trading Scam or Fake Broker

WHAT ARE THE CHARACTERISTICS OF A PYRAMID OR INTERNET INVESTMENT SCAM?

These are some characteristics that can indicate that it is a scam:

  • They offer a safe and high return: an investment has a risk.
  • They offer more profitability and they pay you referrals (recruit).
  • If they ask you to deposit more money to make your investment yield.
  • They call you to offer you a great investment opportunity, just for you.
  • They offer safe earnings with the stock market and cryptocurrencies.

HOW CAN I AVOID BEING A VICTIM OF FINANCIAL INFORMALITY?

In order not to be a victim of financial informality, follow these recommendations:

  • Do not give money to unknown people, even if a friend or relative recommends it.
  • Always verify the identity, address and formal existence of the people or companies with whom you do business, and document all transactions.
  • Always distrust the offer of high interest rates or high profits in short periods of time. (Compare said offer with the profit obtained in the formal financial market).
  • Visit the SBS website and verify which entities have this authorization.

IS THE SAME A MARKETING NETWORK OR A FINANCIAL PYRAMID?

Is not the same. Network marketing, such as the sale of beauty products or food supplements, for example, is a legal business; while the pyramids is a multilevel system, which asks for investment and collapses, affecting the majority of contributors.

HOW DO I KNOW IF THE COMPANY IS AUTHORIZED TO TAKE DEPOSITS?

To find out if the company is authorized to collect deposits, you must go to the page of the Superintendence of Banking, Insurance and AFP (SBS). CLICK HERE

HOW TO REPORT A FINANCIAL PYRAMID?

To report cases that you consider constitute financial pyramids or an Internet scam, you can contact the Superintendency of Banking, Insurance and AFPs (SBS). All communication is treated confidentially.
